gurmukhi: ਫਲ ਫੂਲ ਮੂਲ ਫਲ ਮੂਲ ਫਲ ਫਲ ਮੂਲ ਅਾਦਿ ਪਰਮਾਦਿ ਅਰੁ ਅੰਤ ਕੈ ਅਨੰਤ ਹੈ
transliteration: Dhal Dhool Mool Dhal Mool Dhal Dhal Moola , Aadi Paramaadi Aru Ant Kai Anant Hai ?
translation: From fruit one begets a seed and seed develops into a tree to give fruit, and this process continues. This system of growth has been in vogue before the beginning. Its end is beyond the end.

gurmukhi: ਪਿਤ ਸੁਤ ਸੁਤ ਪਿਤ ਸੁਤ ਪਿਤ ਪਿਤ ਸੁਤ ੳੁਤਪਤਿ ਗਤਿ ਅਤਿ ਗੂੜ ਮੂਲ ਮੰਤ ਹੈ
transliteration: Pit Sout Sout Pit Sout Pit Pit Souta , Outapati Gati Ati Goorh Mool Mant Hai ?
translation: Father begets a son and the son then becomes a father and begets son. Thus continues the system of father-son-father. This convention of creation has very deep quintessence.

gurmukhi: ਪਥਿਕ ਬਸੇਰਾ ਕੋ ਨਿਬੇਰਾ ਜਿੳੁ ਨਿਕਸਿ ਬੈਠ ੲਿਤ ੳੁਤ ਵਾਰ ਪਾਰ ਸਰਿਤਾ ਸਿਧਤ ਹੈ
transliteration: Padik Basayraa Ko Nibayraa Jiu Nikasi Baittha , It Out Vaar Paar Saritaa Sidhat Hai ?
translation: As the end of journey of a traveller depends upon his embarking a boat and then de-embarking from it, crossing the river defines its near and far ends, and these ends keep changing depending upon which direction a traveller is crossing the river from.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਗੁਰ ਗੋਬਿੰਦ ਗੋਬਿੰਦ ਗੁਰ ਅਬਿਗਤ ਗਤਿ ਸਿਮਰਤ ਸਿਖ ਸੰਤ ਹੈ ||੫੬||
transliteration: Pooran Braham Gur Gobind Gobind Gur , Abigat Gati Simarat Sikh Sant Hai ?56?
translation: Similarly all powerful, all knowing Guru is God Himself. He is both Guru and God. This incomprehensible state can best be understood by a Guru-conscious person. (56)
